Administrative / Operations Assistant Job at IDMANN Institute




        
    

        
        IDMANN Institute provides training in professional development and technical entrepreneurship through our College of General Studies and the School of Experiential Learning, respectively. We also provide secondary and pre-secondary tutorial services through IDMANN Academy. All our courses are offered in live sessions with seasoned instructors. Our IDMANN classes offer students the experience of a world-class learning environment with a focus on the development of technical entrepreneurship and tradable professional skills. Our small-class live-instruction format ensures that students can learn quickly by getting the attention and support they need from highly experienced and qualified instructors.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative / Operations Assistant

Job Location: Abia
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive, organized, and detail-oriented Administrative / Operations Assistant to support daily administrative functions and operational activities of the institute.
	The ideal candidate will assist in coordinating office operations, maintaining records, and ensuring smooth day-to-day activities across departments.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide administrative support to management and academic teams
	Handle office correspondence, emails, and phone communications
	Maintain accurate records, files, and documentation
	Assist with scheduling meetings, classes, and operational activities
	Support student records, registrations, and general office duties
	Monitor office supplies and assist with inventory management
	Assist in coordinating staff activities and internal communications
	Support day-to-day operational tasks to ensure efficiency


Requirements & Qualifications


	Minimum of OND / HND / Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Office Technology & Management, Public Administration, Management, or a related field
	1–2 years of administrative or operations experience (preferred)
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills
	Good written and verbal communication skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, email)
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	High level of professionalism and confidentiality


Added Advantage:


	Experience working in an educational or training institution
	Familiarity with digital tools and office management systems.


Benefits


	Competitive salary
	Supportive and professional work environment
	Opportunity for career growth and skill development
	On-the-job training and mentorship


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: work@idmanninstitute.com. using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

	We are seeking a results-driven Marketing Manager to lead and oversee the sales team, improve conversion rates, and drive business growth&mdash;particularly through offline and direct business development channels.

Marketing Manager Job at Elvaridah




        
    

        
        At Elvaridah, we emphasize on the critical matters and prospects of organizations such as business growth, strategy, planning, marketing, structure, and people management across different industries. We help companies focus on the growth of their businesses while aligning costs with strategy. With our all-inclusive approach and expertise, we capture values across the boundaries of any organization. Elvaridah focuses on optimizing all the different parts of a business as a unit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager

Job Location: Lagos / On-site
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a results-driven Marketing Manager to lead and oversee the sales team, improve conversion rates, and drive business growth—particularly through offline and direct business development channels.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring that leads are properly followed up, sales targets are met, and new business opportunities are consistently generated.


Key Responsibilities
Sales Oversight & Conversion Management:


	Supervise and monitor the sales team’s daily activities to ensure effective lead follow-up and high conversion rates.
	Track sales performance, conversion metrics, and pipeline progress.
	Identify gaps in the sales process and implement strategies to improve close rates.
	Conduct regular sales reviews, coaching sessions, and performance evaluations.
	Ensure compliance with approved sales scripts, pricing, and negotiation guidelines.


Offline Business Development:


	Actively source new business opportunities through offline channels such as:
	
		Corporate visits
		Client meetings and presentations
		Networking events and trade fairs
		Partnerships and referrals
	
	
	Build and maintain strong relationships with corporate and individual clients.
	Represent the company professionally in face-to-face engagements.


Marketing & Growth Strategy:


	Develop and execute marketing strategies aligned with revenue and sales targets.
	Collaborate with management to set monthly and quarterly sales goals.
	Provide market intelligence, competitor insights, and customer feedback.
	Support promotional campaigns that directly drive sales conversion.


Reporting & Administration:


	Prepare weekly and monthly sales and marketing performance reports.
	Maintain accurate records of leads, prospects, and closed deals.
	Provide actionable insights and recommendations to management.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
	3–5 years of experience in marketing, sales management, or business development.
	Proven experience managing or supervising a sales team.
	Strong background in offline sales and relationship-driven business development.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and leadership skills.
	Ability to analyze sales data and drive performance improvements.
	Target-oriented, proactive, and highly organized.


Salary
N250,000 (Monthly)

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@elvaridah.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
